title: How to Make a Milk Carton Birdfeeder

steps.headline: Acquire a simple, gallon-size milk carton.
steps.description: Empty it completely, and wipe to dry. Milk can mold with the bird feed.

steps.headline: Get some scissors and cut a quarter-sized hole in the milk carton.
steps.description: You may want to make a bigger opening, depending on ease and the possibilities of other animals enjoying the birds' food.

steps.headline: Add a stick by taping or gluing it to the bottom of the hole.
Fill it up with bird seed, or bird-appropriate food.

text: Acquire a simple, gallon-size milk carton. Empty it completely, and wipe to dry. Milk can mold with the bird feed. Get some scissors and cut a quarter-sized hole in the milk carton. You may want to make a bigger opening, depending on ease and the possibilities of other animals enjoying the birds' food. Add a stick by taping or gluing it to the bottom of the hole.  Fill it up with bird seed, or bird-appropriate food.
